question: how do i change the screen resolution to 1280 by 1024 in the LIVE cd?
Preferences screen resolution - but you may not be able to do it - since of course the LIVE CD, is running off deafault.. "Safe" drivers.
is there any....terminal way to change it?
No unless it's actually installed.. you cannot really modify XORG on a read only media..
You would need to burn your own copy, and basically rewrite the xorg.conf file with the best drivers :)
Well of course not - A cd is read only, and of course the whole "LIVE" part takes place in ram.. so umm yeah.
After you install PROPER video drivers - you click "system -> preferences -> screen resolution" :)
You get the fglrx drivers from synaptic :)
Well you will have to change drivers thats about it hah
Naw you'd be sent back to console thats all.
If you want to play it safe with minimal problems until you get the feel - just put "radeon" as your driver.
Open /etc/X11/xorg - find the "device" section, and rather then "ati" -- replace it with "radeon" -- ctrl-alt-backspace, finito.
Naw you can get it working, but you'll probably have to modify your own stuff
